Translations.Text: What are they asking each other about
The awesome news (of the afterlife)
About which they have (many doubts, discords and) disagreements
By no means! They shall soon find out
Indeed! They shall soon find out
Have We not laid out the earth as a cradle
And (nailed) the Mountains (down) as pegs
We created you all in pairs
We created sleep for you to rest (and rejuvenate)
We made the night (dark as) a cloak (that conceals and covers)
And We made the day (bright) for (you to earn your) livelihood
And We arranged seven (solid and) strong (cosmic systems) over you
And We set up (the sun as) a bright and blazing lamp
And We sent down plenty of water from the rain clouds
To produce with it, the grains and the plants
And lush and luxurious gardens
Certainly! The Day of Decision is a (destined and) definite day
You will all emerge in droves on the day the trumpet sounds
And the heavens would be (uncovered and) opened, as if it had (many wide-open) gates
And the mountains would be (dislodged and) set in motion; they would look like a mirage, (an illusion)
Hell, in fact, lies in ambush
For the transgressors, it will become the (abiding) abode
In it, they will stay for a long stretch of time
There they will not ever taste, much less drink, anything cool
(They will drink) only boiling-hot water, and pus (from wounds)
An apt and apposite outcome
Indeed, never did they anticipate a reckoning
And falsely did they oppose Our verses (and signs)
We have recorded every single thing in a book
Now taste (the consequences of your deeds)! Suffering is all We shall ever bestow _ and increase _ upon you
The triumphant finale shall belong to the pious
The orchards and the vineyards
And blossoming buxom belle _ (the well matched maidens) _ as mates
And the brimful cups (of wine)
Inane nonsense talk and (false) gossip, they shall not hear in paradise
Compensation from your Lord, a bountiful and generous grant
Before Rehman _ the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them _ they won´t dare to speak
On that day, all souls and all angels shall stand (before Him) in rows. No one shall dare to speak unless Rehman grants permission, and on condition that he will speak only what is proper
Such is the day of the truth! (It is sure to arrive). Now, whoever wishes may seek the course towards his Lord
We have certainly warned you of the (imminent and) impending doom. On that day, man would look at the deeds he had sent ahead; he would say, "Alas! if I were only dust
(I swear by the angels) _ those who (violently) wrench out (the souls of the unbelievers)
And those who (gently) draw out (the souls of the believers)
Those who swiftly glide along (in the universe)
Those who rush to carry out
And execute the commands (of the Lord)
That day, (the Day of Decision), a violent jolt will rock (the earth)
And another (jolt) will (soon) follow
That day, hearts would pound (in panic)
And eyes would drift downward (with dread)
They are saying, "What? Would we really be restored back to our former (state of) existence
Even after we are (just) crumbling bones
They say, "Such a (revival and) recurrence is hence a losing proposition
(In fact), it will just take a single rebuke
And at once they will appear on the surface
Has the story of Musa reached you
His Lord summoned him to the holy valley of ´Tuwa´
(And said), "Go to the pharaoh, he is really rebellious
And ask him, "Are you willing to accept purity
(If so), I will guide you towards your Lord; fear Him
And Musa showed him the great sign
But the pharaoh denied and disobeyed
And turned back to hatch a scheme
Then he assembled (his cronies) and announced
He said, "I am your Lord, the most high
So, (as a punishment), Allah turned him into an example in the afterlife, as well as in this life
Of course, there is a lesson in it for all who fear (the reckoning)
(Oh mankind)! Are you the harder to create, or is it the heavens which He built
He raised its vault high, and gave it balance
He imbued the night with darkness, and drew out its morning (glow)
And after that, He spread out the earth
He drafted off its water and produced the fodder
And He fixed the mountains firmly
(All that) for your needs, and those of your livestock
When that most grievous disaster befalls
Man, that day, shall recall all he ever (stood and) strove for
And the hell shall (loom large, and) be made visible to all
Anyone who transgressed (and rebelled)
And preferred the life of this world (to the afterlife)
Would really have hell for a home
While anyone who feared having to stand before his Lord (for a reckoning), and guarded himself against (the base and banal) desires
Would certainly have the paradise for a home
(Oh prophet), they ask you about the hour (of Judgment), "When will that (hour) come to pass
It is not for you to forecast the (actual) date (of its occurrence)
That (knowledge) rests solely with your Lord
You are there to warn anyone who fears (that day)
When they see that day, it will actually be like they have lived (in this world) for just one morning, or a single afternoon
He frowned and turned his face away
Because a blind man came to him (and interrupted him)
You don´t really know! Perhaps he would (shed his disbelief, and) grow in faith
He might heed (the warning); perhaps the reminder would benefit him
(Instead), the one who displays indifference
You attend to
It is not your failing if he fails to cleanse (himself of disbelief)
But, from the one who seeks you eagerly
And fears (Allah)
You divert your attention away
No, in fact this _ (the Qur´an) _ is a reminder
Anyone who cares, may heed
(It is inscribed) in the honored record
Sublime and held in high esteem
Set down by scribes
Noble and virtuous
Man be damned! How ungrateful is he
What was it, from which He created man
From semen! He created man, then assigned his nature
Then, He made the path (of righteousness) easy for him
Then He gave him death, and sent him to his grave
And then He will, whenever He wills, bring him back to life
No! Man did not do what Allah commanded him to do
Let man look at (the source of) his food
(To produce his food), We pour down plenty of water
(Then) We split the ground and lay it open
And out of it, We cause the grain to sprout
And the grapes and vegetables
The olives and dates
Woodland with dense foliage
And the fruits and fodder
Such is your, and your livestock´s sustenance
When the deafening blare (of the trumpet) sounds
Man will run away from his brother that day
And his mother and father
And his wife and son
Everyone that day would have far too many concerns (of his own), to care about others
Some faces that day, would glow
(With) happiness and joyful ecstasy
While some faces that day would be covered with (grim and grimy) shades
And overwhelmed by darkness
Such would be the unbelievers, the obstinate (sinners)
When the sun (and the solar system) is wrapped up
And the stars are rendered dim and dusty
And the mountains are (dislodged and) set in motion
And the pregnant camel is left unattended (by its owner)
And the beasts are herded up
And oceans boil and brim over
(That would be the day) when souls would rejoin their bodies
And the infant girl who was buried alive, would be asked
What was her sin? Why was she killed
When the record (of deeds) is laid open
And the sky is stripped bare
And the hellfire is set ablaze
And the paradise is brought closer
(That day), each soul shall learn what (deeds) it has brought along
No, (I swear) by the planets
And the stars that rise and set
And the night as it departs
And the dawn that breathes (anew)
Of course, this (Qur´an) is really the word brought by the noble messenger _ (the angel, Gibrael)
The one who has power and high rank with the Lord of the throne
(The one who is) obeyed, and is furthermore, trustworthy
(Oh people)! your companion is not crazy
He most definitely saw (the angel, Gibrael) on the clear horizon
And he is not stingy about (disclosing the knowledge of) the unseen
It is not the word of the cursed Shaitan
So, where to, are you headed
This is not anything other than the reminder for the entire world
For every single one of you, anyone who wishes to walk upright along the straight path
But the wishes of any of you do not matter, unless Allah, the Lord of the universe, wills it too
When the sky is split asunder
And the stars are strewn around
And the oceans spill forth
And the graves are overturned (and emptied)
(That is the day when) every soul would learn everything it did, that which it sent ahead, and that which it left behind
(Oh people)! What has lured you away from your Lord, the most Eminent, the Generous
The One Who created you, fashioned you, and gave you (the right) proportions
In whatever form He willed, He brought you into being
No! Rather, you deny the (day of) reward and punishment
Indeed, to watch over you (and record) are
The noble scribes, (the angels)
They know everything you do
Of course, the pious would be in bliss
And the wicked would surely be in hellfire
They shall join it on the Day of Judgment
And (thereafter) they shall never (be allowed to) remain absent from it
What can make you grasp the reality of the Day of Judgment
(Think) again! What can make you grasp the reality of the Day of Judgment
That day, no soul shall have any power to do anything at all for anyone else. That day, the command will belong to Allah (exclusively)
Woe to those who weigh and measure less
Those who insist upon receiving the full measure, when they are the ones receiving
But when they measure and weigh for others, they (short change and) give less than due
Do such people not think that they are going to be resurrected
On an awesome day
That day, all mankind shall stand before the Lord of the universe
Of course not! The book of deeds of the wicked ones is (preserved) in the "Sijjin" _ (the vault)
And how would you know what ´Sijjin´ is
(It is) a book inscribed
Misery that day is for those who belie (the truth)
Those who dispute (and refute) the Day of Judgment
No one disputes it except all the sinful obstinate transgressors
When Our verses are recited to them they say, "Fables of the earlier people
Of course not! Rather, all (the filth) they have earned has rusted and encrusted their hearts
Of course not! In fact, on that day they would be shut out from the Mercy of their Lord
Then, they shall burn in hell
And they would be told, "This is precisely what you used to deny
While the record of deeds of the virtuous is (preserved) in the ´Illiyeen´ _ (the register of the exalted)
And how would you know what ´Illiyeen´ is
(It is) a book inscribed
Those nearest (to Allah, the angels) will attest to it
The righteous ones would be in bliss
Seated on thrones, looking on
You would notice a blissful radiance on their faces
To drink, they would be given the sealed wine, the choicest and the purest
Musk shall be its seal! Those wishing to excel, should excel at this
Its flavor and essence shall consist of ´Tasneem´
A spring! Those closest (to Allah, the righteous ones) would drink from (this spring)
In fact the criminals, the unbelievers, used to laugh at those who believed
As they passed by the believers, they would wink at each other (jokingly)
And when they returned to their family, they returned jesting (and grinning)
Whenever they saw the believers, they said, "These are the people gone astray
The unbelievers were not sent as guardians over the believers
So today, it is the believers´ turn to laugh at the unbelievers
(The believers would be sitting) on elevated thrones, looking on
Now, have the unbelievers not been paid in full for what they did
When the sky splits apart
And heeds its Lord´s command, as it truly must
When the earth distends
Casts off its contents, and becomes bare and blank
It will heed its Lord´s command, as it truly must
Oh man! Indeed, you are steadily advancing towards your Lord. You shall meet Him
Then, the one who is given his record (of deeds) in his right (hand)
Will truly face a light (and lenient) reckoning
And will happily return to his folks
But the one who is given his record of deed behind his back
Will call for (his own) death
But will roast in the fiery blaze
(In his life), he had been happy (and contented) among his kin
And (spuriously) assumed that he would never have to come back (to his Lord)
Why not? His Lord was (always) watching all his deeds
No! Really, I swear by the sunset glow
And the night, and everything it enshrouds
And the moon when it is full
You would definitely move along, from one stage to another
What is with them? Why don´t they believe
When the Qur´an is recited before them, why do they not fall prostrate
Instead, the unbelievers refuse to accept
Indeed, Allah (alone) knows what (kind of) deeds they collect
So give them the news of a painful punishment
(Which will strike all), except those who believe and perform righteous deeds. For them, there exists an unrestricted, ever-lasting reward
(I swear) by the sky, with (all) its constellations
(And by) the promised day (of Judgment)
And (by) the witness (bearing the evidence), as well as the evidence (itself)
Doomed are the people of the ditch
(The ditch) full of fire and abundant fuel
Remember, when the unbelievers sat by the fire
And were themselves witness to what they did to the believers
They were hostile (and rancorous), just because the believers believed in Allah, the most Powerful and the most Praiseworthy
To Whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Allah is the Witness to every single thing
Indeed, those who persecuted the believing men and women and then failed to repent, would (certainly) face the torture of hell. For them, is the punishment of the blazing fire
While the (blissful) paradise _ rivers run right through it _ is for those who believe and do righteous deeds. That is the greatest triumph
Your Lord´s punishment is very severe, indeed
It is He Who created; and He it is, Who will recreate
He is the most Forgiving and the most Loving
Owner of the majestic throne
(The Efficient Achiever)! He does what He pleases
Has the story of the armies reached you
(Armies of) the pharaoh and the (people of) ´Samood´
The unbelievers, in fact (were and) are (persistent) in their denial
Allah has surrounded them all around
This (narrative) is certainly the majestic Qur´an
Safely preserved on (the sacred) slates
(I swear) by the sky, and the night star
And how would you know what the night star is
(It is) a bright star
There is no soul without a guardian over it
Let man look at (and bear in mind) the substance he is created from
(He is) created from the surging fluid
Which springs from between the spine and the ribs
Indeed, He is (certainly) capable of bringing man back to life
That day, (all) secrets would be laid bare
(That day), man shall not have any strength, nor any helpers
(I swear) by the sky that repeatedly sends rain down
And by the earth that splits (and lets plants emerge)
Indeed, this Qur´an is the statement that sifts (right from wrong)
It is not an idle tale
They are hatching a nefarious plot
But I, too, shall devise a scheme
So give the unbelievers a little respite. Deal with them gently for a while
Glorify the name of your Lord, the most High
The One Who created (everything), then (fashioned and) set everything right
Assigned (everything its) nature, then guided it along
The One Who produces the fodder
Then turns it into the decaying scum
(Oh prophet)! We would enable you to recite (the Qur´an). Then, you will not forget (anything)
Except whatever Allah wills. Indeed, He knows the apparent, as well as the concealed
And We will make it easy for you (to adopt) the easy way
So remind (men), for reminder surely helps
The one who fears, will surely heed
And the wretched will stay aloof
And then he will roast in the mammoth fire
Where he shall never die; nor be alive
Successful has been the one who purified himself
And, remembered the name of his Lord and performed the ´salat´
No! In fact, (most of) you prefer the life of this world
Although the hereafter _ (the life-to-come) _ is far superior and more enduring
Certainly, this (is what) was (written) in the earlier scriptures
The scriptures of Ibraheem and Musa
Has the news of that overwhelming (calamity) reached you
(Many) faces that day would be (panic struck and) down cast
Weary and toiling
Burning in the scorching fire
Made to drink from the boiling spring
And having nothing to eat, except (the bitter thorny) cactus
Not enough to nourish or curb the hunger
(Other) faces that day would be happy (and blissful)
Well pleased with (the outcome of) their efforts
In the exalted paradise
There, they shall hear nothing vile or foolish
In paradise, there are gushing springs
And elevated thrones
And carved (exotic) goblets
And cushions set in rows
And spread out (lush rich) carpets
Do they not look at the camel (and wonder)? How (superbly) is it created
And at the sky; how (high) is it raised
And at the mountains; how (firmly) are they planted
And at the earth; how (wide) is it spread out
So, (continue to) remind (them). Indeed, you are (a messenger) to remind (them)
You are not (appointed) a warden over them
As for the one who turns away and disbelieves
Allah will punish him with the direst torment
Of course, back to Us is their return (journey)
Indeed, to call them to accounts is upon Us
(I swear by) the dawn
The ten nights (of the month of ´Hajj´)
Even and odd (numbers)
And the night as it passes
Is there a (more solemn) vow for the sensible ones
Are you not aware of what your Lord did to the (people of) ´Aads´
Those well known for the high pillars (of their architecture)
Such that the likes of them had never been raised in other cities
And (how He dealt) with the people of ´Samood´, who hollowed out huge rocks (and built palaces) in the valley
And with the pharaoh wielding the kingdom
Those who transgressed and crossed all bounds in the lands
And vastly increased mischief and corruption in the land
So your Lord unleashed upon them the scourge of suffering
Indeed, your Lord is ever so vigilant
Such is man! When his Lord puts him through a test by granting him honor and a life of ease, he says, "My Lord has honored me
And when He tests him by restricting his means of livelihood, he says, "My Lord has disgraced me
Not at all! In fact, you do not treat the orphans kindly
Nor do you encourage each other to feed the poor
Greedily, you (misappropriate and) devour the inheritance (of the weak, the widows and the orphans)
You love wealth with all your heart
No, of course not! (On the day) when the earth is pounded repeatedly and crushed
And your Lord (Himself) comes down, along with His angels ranked in rows
And (the day) the hell is brought (in view), is the day when man shall remember clearly. But rememberance then will be of no avail
Man will say, "Alas! If only I had sent ahead of me (the good deeds) for this life of mine
No one can punish (as severely) as He will, that day
No one can tie up and bind as (securely as) He will (that day)
(The righteous would be told), "Oh you, the tranquil peaceful soul
Return to your Lord contented and happy, having won His pleasure
Join My (honored) servants
And enter My (idyllic blissful) paradise
I swear by (the sanctity of) this town (of Makkah)
(Because) you (oh Muhammad, SAW), are allowed in this town
By the father (the first man, prophet Adam), and (all) the children he begot
Surely, We have fashioned man to toil (and undergo a trial)
Does man think that nobody has any power over him
(Boastfully) he says, "I have squandered heaps of wealth
Does he think nobody watches over him
Did We not give him two eyes
A tongue, and the lips
And showed him the two (divergent) paths (of good and evil)
But man does not attempt the harder (uphill course)
And how would you know what the harder course (of action) is
(It is) freeing slaves
And on a day of hunger, feeding (the hungry)
Orphans among the kinsfolk
And the needy among the destitute
Furthermore, (the harder course is) to be among those who believe and persevere (in belief), and persevere with kindness and compassion
Such are the people of the right side _ (the righteous ones)
While those who disbelieve Our verses (and Our signs) are the people of the left side _ (the rebellious ones)
Fire shall besiege and beset them, all around
(I swear) by the sun and its radiant light
And the moon that trails (and reflects) its light
By the day that reveals (the sun)
And the night that veils it
(I swear) by the sky, and (by) Him Who made it
And (by) the earth, and (by) Him Who spread it
By the soul, and by Him Who perfected it
Then, inspired in it the (conscience, the sense of) wrong and right
Successful is the one, who (nurtured and) purified (his soul)
A (dismal) failure is the one who (suppressed and) debased (his soul)
The (people of) ´Samood´ denied (the truth) with utter arrogance
The meanest among them was dispatched
(Against) the messenger of Allah (who) warned them saying, "(Do not attack) this camel of Allah; let it (roam and) drink (freely)
But they refused, and slashed its hamstring. Therefore, as a consequence of their sins, their Lord destroyed them completely; He totally demolished their dwellings
For He does not fear (any) consequence
(I swear) by the night as it veils (the earth in darkness)
And the day, as it unveils
And by Him, Who created (life in pairs,) male and female
In fact your efforts pursue divergent ends
Anyone who gives charity, and fears
And believes in (basic) goodness (and morality)
For such a one, We shall facilitate the easy way, (the way to Islam)
While anyone who acts niggardly, (lives nonchalantly), and considers himself self-sufficient
And rejects the (basic) goodness (and morality)
For such a one, We shall facilitate the path of evil _ (the path that runs contrary to his nature)
How will his wealth avail him when he goes down (into the ditch, his grave)
To grace you (all) with the guidance, is upon Us
Indeed, to Us belongs the afterlife, as well as this one
I warn you (all) about the raging blaze
No one will roast in it, except the most wretched
The one who denied (the truth), and turned away
Far removed from it, would be the righteous one
The one who sought to purify ( his soul), and spent his wealth (in charity)
Not because he had any favors to return
But because he sought the pleasure of his Lord, the most High
(Such a man) would certainly be well pleased
(I swear) by the morning light
And the night, as it becomes calm
(Oh Muhammad, SAW), your Lord has not forsaken you; He is not displeased
The life to come is better for you than the earlier life
Soon, your Lord will grant you (His blessings); you shall be well-pleased
Did He not find you an orphan, and gave you shelter
He found you unguided, and guided you
Found you poor, and enriched you
So do not oppress the orphan
And do not (angrily) repulse (and rebuff) the needy, the beggar
(Rather), proclaim the favors of your Lord
(Oh Muhammad, SAW), did We not lay your chest open (and responsive to the truth)
And We lightened your burden
That bore so heavy on your back
And We raised your prestige (in the world)
The fact is: along with hardship, there is ease
No doubt, along with hardship there is ease
So, when you are done (with your daily chores), attend
And strive to please your Lord
(I swear) by the fig and the olive
And the mount Sinai
And the tranquil land (of Makkah)
We have certainly fashioned man in the finest possible form
Thereafter, We relegated him to being the lowest of the low
Except for those who believe and perform the righteous deeds! For them, there is the unrestricted unending reward
So (oh man), what makes you contradict (the truth about) the reward and punishment
Isn´t Allah absolutely the very Best of all the rulers
Read! In the name of your Lord, Who created (everything that exists)
He creates man from a clot (of blood)
Read! Your Lord is the most Generous
He it is, Who imparted knowledge by the pen
Taught man what he did not know
No, of course not! Man is surely rebellious
For, he thinks he is independent
(Even though his final) return is towards your Lord
Did you (oh Muhammad, SAW), see the one who forbids
The servant (of Allah) to perform ´salat´
What do you think? Is he well guided
And (does he) enjoin piety
Or do you think he denied and turned away
Does he not know that Allah watches (everything)
Of course not! If he did not desist, We will surely drag him by the hair on his forehead
The lying sinful lock of hair
He may then call his henchmen for help
While, We shall summon the guardians of hell
No! Beware! Do not follow such a one. (Rather), fall prostrate and draw closer (to Allah)
Certainly, We have revealed it _ (the Qur´an) _ in the Night of Decree
And what do you understand by the Night of Decree
The Night of Power is better than a thousand months
Bearing the divine decrees, the angels and the spirits descend during the night with the permission of their Lord
Blissful and serene is that night, right until the day breaks
Those of the people of the scriptures and the polytheists who do not believe, will not give up (disbelief) until the clear evidence comes to them
The messenger of Allah recites from the sacred and sanctified scripture _ (the Qur´an)
Containing sound and straightforward rules
Those given the (earlier) scriptures (argued and) differed amongst themselves after clear proofs had already come to them

What they were commanded was to worship only Allah with sincerity and exclusive devotion; and to worship nothing and nobody else with Him. (They were ordered) to establish ´salat´, and to pay the ´zakat´. That is truly the stable (and established) religion
Whoever denies among the people of the book and the polytheists, would be in the fire of hell, and would stay there forever. Such are the worst of the creation
While those who believe and do good deeds are certainly the best of the creation

Their reward, the paradise of Eden _ rivers run right through it _ is with their Lord. They shall live there forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they with Him! This is for the one who fears his Lord
When the earth is shaken up with a cataclysmic quake
And the earth yields and disgorges (all) its burden
And man remarks, "What is the matter with it
That day, it will recount all that ever occurred on it
For, your Lord shall have ordered it (to do so)
On that day, people will come out (of their graves) separately, so they may be shown (the result of) their deeds
Then, whoever did (even) an atom´s worth of good, shall see it
And whoever commits an atom´s worth of evil, shall see it
(I swear by) these panting snorting horses
Striking sparks (with their hooves)
Dashing to assault by dawn
Kicking up clouds of dust
And storming blindly into the crowds
Man is indeed ungrateful to his Lord
And to that fact, he is himself a witness
He surely loves wealth and riches with a passion
Does he not know, that when all the contents of the graves are disgorged
And all the secrets buried in the hearts are divulged
That day, (they would learn that) their Lord is thoroughly Knowledgeable about their deeds
That awesome (stunning) disaster
What is (that) awesome disaster
What do you suppose is that awesome disaster
That day, people would be like scattered (confused) moths
And the mountains like the fluffy tufts of colored wool
Anyone whose scales (of good deeds) weigh heavier
Would live in a state of bliss
As for the one whose scale (of good deeds) is lighter
An abysmal pit would totally engulf him
And what do you think is (the content of) the abysmal pit
Hot blazing fire
(Oh men! Your obsession to attain, hoard and show off) opulence diverts you (and keeps you busy)
Right until you land in (your) graves
No, surely not! You shall soon find out
Again, be sure! You shall soon find out
No, of course not! If you only knew with certainty
You shall surely see hell
Then, you would really see it with the eye of certainty
And then, you would certainly be called to account for the blessings and the bounties
(I swear) by Time
Indeed, mankind happens to be in a state of a grave loss
Except for those who believe, perform good deeds, strive for the truth, and strive with patience and perseverance
Misery is for the slanderer and the backbiter
The one who gathers wealth; and counts it (zestfully)
And thinks that his wealth confers immortality
Of course not! He will certainly be flung into the ´Wrecker´
And what do you suppose is the ´Wrecker´
(It is) the fire of Allah, kindled ablaze
Which will rise (and reach) up to (clutch) the hearts
Indeed, an inverted dome (of fire) would be (placed) upon them
Enclosed in (a fence of) tall pillars
Are you not aware of how your Lord dealt with the army accompanied by the elephants
Did He not make their (evil) plans go awry
He let loose upon them a large flock of birds
That pelted them with pellets made of baked clay
Thus, He turned them into the chewed out chaff
(The tribe of) Quraish is well known
Renowned for their summer and winter journeys
They should (devotedly) worship the Lord of this house (the ´Kaaba´ in Makkah)
Who feeds them, and protects them from (famine and) hunger. And secures them from (danger and) fear
Haven´t you seen the one who rejects the fact of the reward and punishment
He is (really) the one who (shoos and) shoves away the orphans harshly
And does not promote the feeding of the poor
Of course, misery is for (some of) those who perform ´salat´
Those among them who stay unmindful of their "salat´
Those who aim to be seen (doing good)
And they hold back even minor favors
For sure, We granted you (excellence and) abundance
So pray only to your Lord, and offer sacrifice
For anyone who hates you, will be cut off (from your Lord´s mercy)
Say, "Oh you unbelievers
That which you worship is not what I worship
And you are not going to worship the One that I worship
I shall never worship that which you serve so devotedly
Nor will you worship Whom I worship
You have your faith, and I have mine
Once Allah´s help _ and with it, the victory _ arrives
You shall see people throng (and embrace) the religion of Allah in large numbers
So chant the praises of your Lord, and beg His forgiveness. Of course, it is really He Who accepts repentance and grants forgiveness
May the hands of Abu Lahab _ (an uncle of the Prophet) _ perish; and so may he
(All) his wealth, and everything he has earned failed him
Soon, he will roast in the blazing fire
And his woman, that tale-bearing malicious gossip
Shall have a rope of palm fibers around her neck
Say "He _ (Allah) _ is One, (the most Unique)
Allah is the Self-sufficient Master _ (the Ultimate Source, the Uncaused Cause)
He did not beget, and He was not begotten
And, there is absolutely no one equal to Him; no one is even remotely comparable
Say, "I seek refuge with (Allah), the Lord of the nascent dawn
From the evil He has created
From the evil of darkness as it deepens (during the night)
From the evil of (women practicing) witchcraft, and blowing (spells) over knotted ropes
And from the evil of the grudgeful, as he turns green with jealousy
Say, "I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind
The King of mankind
The God of mankind
(I seek refuge) from the evil of the devil _ (the whispering tempter)
The one who (breathes doubts and) whispers in the hearts of mankind
Amongst the jinn and the human kind
